alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Sherman (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued October 03 at 4:29PM CDT until October 03 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Buffalo County in south central Nebraska... South central Sherman County in central Nebraska... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 429 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Pleasanton, or 17 miles north of Kearney, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Pleasanton around 435 PM CDT. Poole around 440 PM CDT. Ravenna around 445 PM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
